Common.Highlight.Common.Text: The current owners have invested considerable time and resources towards applying to and navigating the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation (“DEC”) Brownfield Cleanup Program (“BCP11 ), and were awarded acceptance into the program in 2017. Recent additional developments with DEC have solidified the specific cleanup track, remaining cleanup work estimates, and thus a range of tax credit benefits applicable to both the cleanup costs and future construction costs

The sellers are open to an outright sale of the property in its “as is” condition, but would prefer a joint venture opportunity with a qualified development team. An ideal joint venture scenario would involve a mixed use development that provides community benefit(s) both from ground floor commercial use(s) as well as upper floor residential that incorporates workforce and/or affordable housing.
All interested parties will be required to sign a NDA prior to review of additional information.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Located between Caroline and Phila Streets, directly across from the Saratoga Springs Public Library

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Offered for sale is one of the last undeveloped properties in downtown Saratoga Springs. Virtually impossible to replicate in terms of location, the site is
strategically located between Caroline and Phila Streets, directly across from the Saratoga Springs Public Library and one block from Broadway.
The property is located within the Transect 6 - Urban Core zoning district, whose intent is described by the Saratoga Springs Zoning Ordinance as: “To accommodate highest intensity and diversity of retail, business and upper floor residential uses. This district focuses on high quality design and materials consistent with historic downtown form and promotes an active pedestrian oriented public realm.” The zoning district permits construction up to a maximum of 70 feet and virtually 100% lot coverage.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Redevelopment Site in Downtown Saratoga Springs for SALE

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is a ±27,000 SF retail/office/flex building located in Syracuse, New York.
The Property consists of a single-story, concrete block & steel frame building situated on a ±1.76-acre parcel.
It features ±125 parking spaces (±4.63/1,000 SF ratio), ±170’ of high-profile frontage on Erie Boulevard E, a new TPO roof in 2016 with a 20-year warranty, and a utility storage garage with one ±9’ overhead door. 
2921 Erie Boulevard E is currently ±17% occupied by a single tenant, Empire Visionworks. Empire is a long-term tenant in the 4,600 SF front portion of the building. 
The remaining SF of remaining space includes reception, conference rooms, several private offices, bullpen area, cubicles, lunch room, mail room, copier room, electrical room, restrooms, and the aforementioned utility storage garage.

Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: Floor Plan - 1st floor Stewart Title 333 E. Washington Street

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
1.5 floors of professional office space totaling 7,945 sf located 1/2 block from the Onondaga County Courthouse. The 1st floor of this suite offers 5,237 square feet including: six windowed offices (two more can be built); Reception Area; ample area for landscape furniture; 340 sf Conference Room w/ dividable folding partition.  Then, an open staircase leads to the lower level of 2,708 sf offices; large kitchen/break room; two separate rest rooms; and 2,000 sf of open record storage.

Condo "By-Laws" and "Declaration" available upon request.

- Currently occupied by single tenant, this office building is easily converted to a multi-occupant office building.
- Space is fully built-out with perimeter offices; large conference; full kitchen; storage; mechanical room
- Lot Size:  .19 acres
- Parking Spaces: 15+-
- Built in 1974
- Fully Renovated in 2012: New Roof; All New HVAC; New Windows: All New Electric Service; New Security System; New 20,000 KVW Generac Generator

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
This offering consists of five buildings totaling 123,625 square feet on 12 acres of land within the Southview Commons office and retail development in suburban Rochester, New York (Town of Brighton).   Centrally located in a densely developed area, these properties offer superior expressway access and are neighbors to Monroe Community College, The University of Rochester Medical Center (Strong), office parks, hotels, multi-family residential and retail amenities.
The portfolio currently has 68,936 square feet leased (55.8% occupied) and includes a fully occupied office building, two multi-story office building which underwent extensive renovations from 2018 - 2020, and a mixed-use retail and office plaza with additional development potential.

Common.PostalAddresses.Common.Line1: Walter J. Mahoney State Office Building

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The Mahoney Building’s size and configuration make it an ideal candidate for redevelopment. The building’s location on
Niagara Square places it in a key position in the city’s downtown central business district, adjacent to government, private
sector offices, restaurants, churches, hotels, and the Buffalo Niagara Convention Center.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
CBRE, in conjunction with the New York State Office of General Services (OGS), is pleased to present the unique offering of the Walter J. Mahoney State Office Building (“Mahoney Building” or “Mahoney”) located in downtown Buffalo, NY. The 1928 Green & Wicks, 69,000± square foot former office building is located at Niagara Square in the central business district in proximity to several prominent buildings including Buffalo City Hall, Dillon Court House, Buffalo Niagara Convention Center, The Statler, and Robert H. Jackson United States Court House. The five-story neo-classical and art deco building has been home to numerous New York State agencies, which have continuously occupied the building since its opening in 1931. 

The building will be sold fully vacant and available for ownership and redevelopment by the private sector. The sale will occur through public auction at 10 a.m. on October 7, 2021 on the first floor of the Mahoney Building.

Please visit www.mahoneybuffalo.com for complete details about the property and auction.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Currently divided into 40 units, a mix of individual and group suites

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Prominent location in a Qualified Opportunity Zone on Niagara Square near Buffalo City Hall in the Joseph Ellicott Historic Preservation District. The property is situated among recent and ongoing development projects including Statler City, Buffalo Police & Fire Headquarters, and the ACB Building.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
This five story office building with basement at the edge of Niagara Square offers 28,100 square feet of office space, currently divided into a mix of individual and group suites. Many law firms have taken up residence at 70 Niagara due to its location central to numerous courts and government offices.

Constructed in 1925 as the Schoelkopf, Hutton & Pomeroy Investment Bank
